candidates.why: Same lite-family structure (multi-angle agent, optional clarification, plan + confirmation, handoff to lite-execute) and same allowed-tools surface.
Directly relevant as the execution handoff target; useful for context packaging and execution confirmation patterns (but different allowed-tools, includes Bash).
Bug-focused workflow with iterative debugging and session artifacts; heavier tool surface than lite-fix.
Fix-oriented orchestrator that produces artifacts and coordinates multiple phases; less aligned with lite workflow and different tools.
Planning conventions and section structure reference; not a lightweight, severity-driven bug fix flow.

selected.reason: Closest match in interaction model and command structure; easiest to adapt without introducing new patterns.
